column4: seems to me people only like answering the complex questions so those of us trying to learn kinda get frozen out
i've never used ubuntu one so i dunno a wit about it. but if you got meessed up with versions is becouse you upgraded the provided client by hand instead of using the one in the repositories
thanks for that but you are wrong. I use the repositories for updates.
so; there is aclear bug ? have you reported it (or maybe is already known)?
then you can try to force the install of an lder version...
Cheers for the help. it still isnt working but I am getting closer I think. Will keep on trying.
locally you mean on your lan only on on your machine only ?
locally on my machine only. I am on a laptop always using different wireless connections for access so security is in flux
then there should be a conf option for the web server to listen only in lo:127.0.0.1 (localhost)
It is the Apache config file I need to edit right?
probably yes something like Listen = 127.0.0.1 or something to that effect (apache conf is xml ...)
I am being really idiotic trying to find the file. Dont help, I need to know how to find this stuff myself
well debian/ubuntu likes to chop conf files in many tiny files under .d directories ;P
